Guruhi

The Guruhi and their unique irp disciplines combination have excellent vampires with outstanding abilities. This led to the {{ link("/archetypes/nananimalism", _("Nananimalism")) }} archetype, a weenie i build using {{ card("Nana Buruku") }} as star, and the {{ link("/archetypes/guruhi-rush", _("Guruhi Rush")) }}, using {{ card("Nangila Were") }} and the ip combination for combat.

The lack of damage prevention is an issue for combat-oriented builds, but the access to {{ card("Immortal Grapple") }} makes up for it. Multiple vote constructs have also been seen.

Highlights

Nana Buruku

played in 91 decks, typically 2-4 copies

The absolute star of the Guruhi clan, she is often played for her rare ability to grant more Master actions. Her disciplines are often a secondary subject and she is largely played in non-Guruhi constructs.

Fish

played in 39 decks, typically 1-2 copies

AP for only 5 pool is a bargain. An easy inclusion in any Guruhi or Nosferatu build.

Nangila Were

played in 24 decks, typically 1-3 copies

All clan disciplines at superior with a rush ability included. A must-have in rush decks, often played along {{ card("Nana Buruku") }}.

Lumumba

played in 16 decks, typically 1 copy

A cheap price for superior R, he can even be included in mono r builds.

Founders of the Ebony Kingdom

played in 15 decks, typically 2-7 copies

One of the best bloating device in the game, only available to Guruhi and difficult to play in multi-clans decks.

Lucian, the Perfect

played in 14 decks, typically 1-4 copies

The only vampire of the game with a bleed power of 4. Worth mentioning, even if he is often played in big capacity DO decks with no Guruhi specifics.

Guruhi Kholo

played in 13 decks, typically 1 copy

An additional title that is unlikely to contest, it's a worthy inclusion in a political deck and a useful addition to {{ card("Nana Buruku") }} or {{ card("Aren") }}.

Ugadja

played in 11 decks, typically 1-2 copies

A magaji with a useful ability, his cost is a bit steep, but he finds his place in a political deck, and his W discipline can get him into Akunanse decks, although he is more often associated with {{ card("Eze, The Demon Prince") }}.
